intro: Licaria puchury-major, commonly known as the Puchury Major, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
